passage.text: Cisapride decreases gastric content aspiration in mechanically ventilated patients

We found that even in patients kept in a semirecumbent position, aspiration of gastric contents still occurs and this finding was correct. Cisapride reduced the amount of airway gastritis associated with ventilator-associated pneumonia in intubated and mechanically ventilated patients, but it did not prevent complete gastrinary aspartam inciprance (even when the patient was in the semirest position).
